Detroit MI, 48215-2667
Re: License #: CI820201513
Dear Dominique Clements:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, area manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI820201513
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Wollack
Chief Administrator: Domonique Deshaun Cobb
Agency Name: Wolverine Center
Agency Address: 2629 Lenox Street
Detroit, MI 48215-2667
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/31/2023
Capacity: 20

received or

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A and Youth B sexually acted out at Wolverine Center.
Investigation Complainant
I spoke with Complainant by phone on 05/22/2023. Complainant is
the foster home licensing worker for Foster parent. Complainant
stated Youth A was placed in Foster parent’s home and Youth B
was later placed in the same foster home. Complainant stated
Foster parent told her Youth A froze when he first saw Youth B in
the home and Foster parent redirected Youth B from giving Youth
A a hug. Complainant stated Foster parent previously overheard
Youth A on the phone with his mother talking about a sexual
incident occurring at Wolverine Center.
Foster parent
I interviewed Foster parent by phone on 05/22/2023. Foster parent
stated Youth A and Youth B were placed in her home. Foster
parent stated she overheard Youth A’s mother talking with Youth
A about inappropriate contact. Foster parent stated she intervened
and asked Youth A’s mother not to discuss sensitive topics on
speaker phone due to other youths being in the home. Foster
parent stated she recalled the look on Youth A’s face when he
saw Youth B in the home and put the two together. Foster parent
stated she spoke with Youth A and Youth A identified having a
boundary issue with Youth B at a previous placement. Foster
parent stated she did not ask for details, but notified Complainant.
Youth A
Another Department of Health and Human Service worker referred
this investigation to law enforcement on 04/13/2023. Another
Department of Health and Human Service worker and I made face
to face contact with Youth A at New Directions during his intake
on 04/13/2023. Youth A stated he was not anxious about his
replacement to New Directions. Youth A’s foster care worker
transported Youth A to New Directions and was present during
Youth A’s intake. Youth A’s foster care worker stated he did not
2

have concerns with Youth A’s placement at Wolverine Center.
Youth A’s foster care worker stated there was an investigation in
2019 about Youth A and another youth (not Youth B) sexually
acting out.
I interviewed Youth A face to face at New Directions on
05/22/2023. Youth A verbalized an understanding of personal
boundaries. Youth A stated he knew Youth B from Christ Child
House. Youth A said Youth B “tried to touch my private parts, but I
said no.” I asked Youth A if Youth B was also at Wolverine Center.
Youth A stated Youth B was also at Wolverine Center and at his
last foster home placement. Youth A stated Youth B never
crossed boundaries with him at Wolverine Center or foster home
placement. Youth A denied any boundary or sexual incident at
Wolverine Center.
I reviewed MiSACWIS. Youth A was at Christ Child House from
12/19/18 to 03/23/2020 and 11/23/2021 to 08/19/2022.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B face to face at Oakland County Children
Village on 05/26/2023. Youth B stated he was never placed at
Christ Child House. Youth B stated he knew Youth A from
Wolverine Center and foster home placement. Youth B stated he
had a good relationship with Youth A. Youth B stated he and
Youth A would play video games and Pokemon cards together.
Youth B stated he never had boundary issues or a sexual incident
with Youth A.
I reviewed MiSACWIS. Youth B was never placed at Christ Child
House.
Chief administrator
I spoke with Wolverine Center’s Chief administrator on 04/12/2023
by phone. Chief administrator confirmed Youth A and Youth B
were at Wolverine Center at the same time from 03/03/2023 to
03/07/2023. Chief administrator stated Wolverine Center is
unaware and does not have an incident report about Youth A and
Youth B crossing boundaries or sexually acting out.
Another Department of Health and Human Service worker
completed an investigation without findings.
Analysis Youth A and Youth B denied having a sexual incident between
them. Wolverine Center does not have information about a sexual
incident between Youth A and Youth B. This investigation will be
3

reopened if further information becomes available. It is found that
Wolverine Center provided for the needs, supervision, and
protection of Youth A and Youth B.
Conclusion VIOATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
05/31/2023
_____________________________________
Vivian D Malleck Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
6/2/23
